subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: The sprinter Dwain Chambers will run for Britain at the world indoor track and field championships next month in Spain after winning a legal fight to be placed on the team.The British selection committee said Tuesday that it reluctantly agreed to put Chambers on the team. He earned a spot on the team by winning the 60-meter race at Sunday’s qualifier.He served a two-year suspension, from 2003 to 2005, after testing positive for the steroid THG, and returned to the sport only six weeks ago.Britain’s governing body for track and field had said he could not run until he had spent a year proving he was drug-free, but Chambers challenged that ruling. One of his lawyers, Nick Collins, said UK Athletics had no legal case to bar him.
